div.head: Description:
div.p: Indicates a point in time either absolutely (using the absolute attribute), or relative to other elements in the same timeline element (using the interval and since attributes). The data attribute may be used to reference one or more features that occur at this point in time.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Defines a rectangular area contained within a surface.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the pedal setting, i.e., flat, natural, or sharp, for the harp's A strings.

div.head: Description:
div.p: captures the unabbreviated form of the text.

div.head: Description:
div.p: provides an absolute value for the time associated with a point on a timeline. This attribute is required for the element designated as the origin by the parent timeline.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the performed pitch inflection when it differs from the written accidental.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the written accidental associated with a lower neighboring note.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the written accidental associated with an upper neighboring note.

div.head: Description:
div.p: signifies the causative agent of damage, illegibility, or other loss of original text.

div.head: Description:
div.p: specifies how the stacked text should be aligned.

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to extend the values of the rend attribute. One or the other of the rend and altrend attributes is required.

div.head: Description:
div.p: provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: beatrpt, breath, chord, clef, clefchange, fermata, halfmrpt, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, note, rest, uneume

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the amount of detuning. The decimal values should be rendered as a fraction (or an integer plus a fraction) along with the bend symbol.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: accessdesc, acqsource, altmeiid, availability, change, changedesc, classcode, classification, condition, corpname, correction, creation, date, dimensions, edition, editionstmt, editorialdecl, encodingdesc, event, eventdesc, eventlist, exhibithist, extent, filedesc, geogname, hand, handlist, identifier, inscription, interpretation, keywords, language, langusage, meihead, name, normalization, notesstmt, periodname, persname, physdesc, physloc, physmedium, price, profiledesc, projectdesc, provenance, pubstmt, repository, respstmt, revisiondesc, samplingdecl, segmentation, seriesstmt, source, stdvals, stylename, sysreq, term, titlestmt, treatmenthist, treatmentsched, unpub, userestrict

div.head: Description:
div.p: may be used when an arrowhead is to be drawn as part of the arpeggiation symbol.

div.head: Description:
div.p: encodes the written articulation(s). Articulations are normally encoded in order from the notehead outward; that is, away from the stem. See additional notes at att.vis.note. Only articulations should be encoded in the artic attribute; fingerings should be encoded using the <dir> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records performed articulation that differs from the written value.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains the name of the list from which an authorized value is taken.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: corpname, geogname, language, name, periodname, persname, physmedium, repository, resp, stylename, title

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the pedal setting, i.e., flat, natural, or sharp, for the harp's B strings.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the location of a barline.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates whether barlines go across the space between staves (true) or are only drawn across the lines of each staff (false).

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates that this event is "under a beam".

div.head: Description:
div.p: provides an example of how beaming (including secondary beams) is to be performed. It can be used to set a default beaming pattern to be used when no beaming is indicated at the event level. beam.group must contain a comma-separated list of time values that add up to a measure, e.g., in 4/4 time '4,4,4,4' indicates each quarter note worth of shorter notes would be beamed together. Parentheses can be used to indicate sub-groupings of secondary beams. For example, '(4.,4.,4.)' in 9/8 meter indicates one outer beam per measure with secondary beams broken at each dotted quarter duration, while a measure of 16th notes in 4/4 with beam.group equal to '(4,4),(4,4)' will result in a primary beam covering all the notes and secondary beams each group of 4 notes. This beaming "directive" can be overridden by using <beam> elements. If neither <beam> elements or the beam.group attribute is used, then no beaming is rendered. Beaming can be 'turned off' by setting beam.group to an empty string.

div.head: Description:
div.p: encodes whether a beam is feathered and in which direction.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates whether beams should include rests shorter than a quarter note duration.

div.head: Description:
div.p: In the case of cross-staff beams, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the placement of Bezier control points as a series of space-separated xy coordinates, eg. 19 45 -32 118.

div.head: Description:
div.p: When the block attribute is used, combinations of the 1, 2, and 4 measure rest forms (Read, p. 104) should be rendered instead of the modern form or the alternative symbol.

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to state where a tuplet bracket will be placed in relation to the noteheads.

div.head: Description:
div.p: states whether a bracket should be rendered with a tuplet.

div.head: Description:
div.p: presence of this attribute indicates that the secondary beam should be broken following this note/chord. The value of the attribute records the number of beams which should remain unbroken.

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes a curve as a set of distance values above or below an imaginary line connecting the endpoints of the curve. The bulge attribute must contain one or more decimal values expressed in inter-line units.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the pedal setting, i.e., flat, natural, or sharp, for the harp's C strings.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the system or calendar to which a date belongs, for example, Gregorian, Julian, Roman, Mosaic, Revolutionary, Islamic, etc.

div.head: Description:
div.p: classifies the cause for the variant reading, according to any appropriate typology of possible origins.

div.head: Description:
div.p: signifies the degree of certainty or precision associated with a feature.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: abbr, add, corpname, corr, date, expan, gap, geogname, handshift, orig, periodname, persname, reg, stylename, supplied, unclear

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes the character of the new hand.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains a reference to a predefined <chorddef> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains a reference to the controlled vocabulary from which the term is drawn. The value must match the value of an ID attribute on a classcode element given elsewhere in the document.

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes the color of the clef.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the amount of octave displacement to be applied to the clef.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the direction of octave displacement to be applied to the clef.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains a default value for the position of the clef.

div.head: Description:
div.p: encodes a value for the clef symbol.

div.head: Description:
div.p: determines whether the clef is to be displayed.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates an alternative notehead should be displayed instead of individual noteheads. See Read, p. 320-321, re: tone clusters.

div.head: Description:
div.p: encodes whether the octave displacement should be performed simultaneously with the written notes, i.e., 'colla ottava'. See Read, p. 47-48.

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: accid, arpeg, artic, barline, beatrpt, bend, breath, chord, clef, clefchange, curve, custos, dot, fermata, gliss, hairpin, halfmrpt, harppedal, ineume, line, mensur, mordent, mrpt, mrpt2, note, pedal, phrase, reh, rend, rest, slur, symbol, tie, trill, turn, uneume

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates this feature is 'colored'; that is, it is a participant in a change in rhythmic values. In mensural notation, coloration is indicated by colored notes (red, black, etc.) where void notes would otherwise occur. In CMN notation, coloration is indicated by an inverse color; that is, the notehead is void when it would otherwise be filled and vice versa.

div.head: Description:
div.p: the number of columns spanned by this cell.

div.head: Description:
div.p: a value of 'c' (complete) indicates a metrically complete measure, 'i' (incomplete) indicates a measure with not enough beats, while 'o' (overfull) is for measures with too many beats.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates whether a space is 'compressable', i.e., if it may be removed at the disgression of processing software.

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes the symbols typically used to indicate breaks between syllables: s (_s_pace) = word separator, d (_d_ash) = syllable separator, u (_u_nderscore) = syllable extension, t (_t_ilde) = syllable elision

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates whether or not a barline is "controlling"; that is, if it indicates a point of alignment across all the parts. Barlines within a score are usually controlling; that is, they "line up". Barlines within parts may or may not be controlling. When applied to <measure>, this attribute indicates the nature of the right barline but not the left.

div.head: Description:
div.p: points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: accid, anchoredtext, annot, arpeg, artic, barline, beam, beamspan, beatrpt, bend, breath, btrem, cc, chan, chanpr, chord, clef, clefchange, cue, curve, custos, dir, dot, dynam, ending, fermata, ftrem, gliss, grpsym, hairpin, halfmrpt, harm, harppedal, hex, ineume, layer, lem, ligature, line, lyrics, marker, measure, mensur, metatext, midi, mordent, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, note, noteoff, noteon, octave, ossia, part, parts, pedal, phrase, port, prog, proport, rdg, reh, rest, sb, score, section, seqnum, slur, space, staff, syl, symbol, tempo, tie, trill, trkname, tuplet, tupletspan, turn, uneume, vel, verse

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: accid, anchoredtext, annot, arpeg, artic, barline, beam, beamspan, beatrpt, bend, breath, btrem, cc, chan, chanpr, chord, clef, clefchange, cue, curve, custos, dir, dot, dynam, ending, fermata, ftrem, gliss, grpsym, hairpin, halfmrpt, harm, harppedal, hex, ineume, layer, lem, ligature, line, lyrics, marker, measure, mensur, metatext, midi, mordent, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, note, noteoff, noteon, octave, ossia, part, parts, pedal, phrase, port, prog, proport, rdg, reh, rest, sb, score, section, seqnum, slur, space, staff, syl, symbol, tempo, tie, trill, trkname, tuplet, tupletspan, turn, uneume, vel, verse

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the degree of correction applied to the text.

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes a curve with a generic term indicating whether the curve bows upward or downward. Upward curves go above the items they cover, while downward curves go under them.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Presence of the cutout attribute indicates that the staff lines should not be drawn for the measure containing this element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the pedal setting, i.e., flat, natural, or sharp, for the harp's D strings.

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to link metadata elements to one or more data-containing elements.

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to record a value which serves as a primary key in an external database.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: corpname, geogname, name, periodname, persname, repository, stylename, title

div.head: Description:
div.p: When the delayed attribute is set to 'yes', the turn begins on the second half of the beat. See Read, p. 246.

div.head: Description:
div.p: gives the delimiter used to mark the portions of text that are to be stacked.

div.head: Description:
div.p: provides a description of the means of restoration.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the position of the piano damper pedal.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the amount of octave displacement.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the direction of octave displacement.

div.head: Description:
div.p: specifies whether a dot is to be added to the base symbol.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the number of augmentation dots required by a dotted duration.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: chord, note, rest, space, tuplet, tupletspan

div.head: Description:
div.p: encodes the duration of a feature as a timestamp for its endpoint rather than as a relative durational value.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: annot, dir, dynam, hairpin, harm, octave, phrase, slur, trill

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the duration of a feature using the relative durational values provided by the data.DURATION datatype.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: beamspan, chord, halfmrpt, mrest, mspace, note, rest, space

div.head: Description:
div.p: captures the time taken up by the tuplet. Unlike other control events where the dur attribute is expressed as a time stamp, dur here is a true duration. If dur is omitted, the default is to calculate the total duration of the included notes and use the next shorter un-dotted value. Irrational durations, such as 2 quarter notes in the time of 5 8th notes in a measure of 5/8 time, may be expressed as a list of durations which are to be added together to form the total duration. In this case, the dur attribute could take the value "2 8" or "8 8 8 8 8".

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains a default duration in those situations when the first note, rest, chord, etc. in a measure does not have a duration specified.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records performed duration information that differs from written duration. Its value may be expressed in any convenient form, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the function of the dot; that is, whether it is a dot of augmentation or a dot of division.

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to identify and format a list. In a "simple" list, <item>s are not numbered or bulleted. In a "marked" list, the sequence of the list items is not critical, and a bullet, box, dash, or other character is displayed at the start of each <item>. In an "ordered" list, the sequence of the items is important, and each <item> is lettered or numbered. Style sheet functions should be used to specify the mark or numeration system for each <item>.

div.head: Description:
div.p: specifies whether the accidental allows written enharmonic values (explicit) or only performed (implicit) values.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates whether the base symbol is written vertically or horizontally.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates whether this is note-on or note-off velocity data.

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes the visual appearance of the fermata.

div.head: Description:
div.p: captures the form and function of the hairpin.

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes the bowed tremolo as measured or unmeasured.

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes whether the tremolo is measured or unmeasured.

div.head: Description:
div.p: provides an indication of the function of the ligature.

div.head: Description:
div.p: 'norm' signals the normal form, that is, the written note, followed by its lower neighbor, with a return to the written note, while 'inv' indicates the inverted form, that is, the principal note, followed by its upper neighbor, with a return to the principal note. Traditionally, the 'normal' mordent is written as a short wavy line with a vertical line through it and the inverted mordent is written without the vertical line. However, the meaning of these signs is sometimes reversed. See Read, p. 245-246. Another attribute in the visual domain would be necessary in order to be completely explicit about which visual symbol is actually to be rendered.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates whether the turn begins on the note above (norm) or on the note below (inv).

div.head: Description:
div.p: provides a subclass or functional label for the neume.

div.head: Description:
div.p: provides a subclass or functional label for the neume.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the location at which a string should be stopped against a fret.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records whether the accidental has an editorial or cautionary function.

div.head: Description:
div.p: states whether the line break follows a single line or a line group.

div.head: Description:
div.p: states the side of a leaf (as in a manuscript) on which the content following the <pb> element occurs.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the pedal setting, i.e., flat, natural, or sharp, for the harp's G strings.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates that this element participates in a glissando.

div.head: Description:
div.p: marks a note or chord as a "grace" (without a definitive written duration) and records from which other note/chord it should "steal" time.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the amount of time to be "stolen" from a non-grace note/chord.

div.head: Description:
div.p: determines whether to display guitar chord grids.

div.head: Description:
div.p: determines whether to display guitar chord grids.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to override the headshape normally used for the given duration.

div.head: Description:
div.p: measurement of the vertical dimension of an image.

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes harmonic function in any convenient typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records a horizontal adjustment of a feature's programmatically-determinded location in terms of staff interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

div.head: Description:
div.p: specifies the (positive) numeric portion of a time interval.

div.head: Description:
div.p: encodes the harmonic interval between this note and other pitches occuring at the same time.

div.head: Description:
div.p: encodes the melodic interval from the previous pitch.

div.head: Description:
div.p: used for linking visually separate slurs, sometimes necessary due to system breaks, that form a single musical phrase. Also used to indicate a measure which metrically completes the current one. Record the IDs of the separately encoded components, excluding this one.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains an accidental for the tonic key, if one is required, e.g., if key.pname equals 'c' and key.accid equals 's', then a tonic of C# is indicated.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates major, minor, or other tonality.

div.head: Description:
div.p: holds the pitch name of the tonic key, e.g. 'c' for the key of C.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates where the key lies in the circle of fifths.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Mixed key signatures, e.g. those consisting of a mixture of flats and sharps (Read, p. 143, ex. 9-39), and key signatures with unorthodox placement of the accidentals (Read, p. 141) must be indicated by setting the key.sig attribute to 'mixed' and providing explicit keysig info in the key.sig.mixed attribute or in the <keysig> element. It is intended that key.sig.mixed contain a series of tokens with each token containing pitch name, accidental, and octave, such as 'As4 Cs5 Ef5' that indicate what key accidentals should be rendered and where they should be placed.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates whether the key signature should be displayed.

div.head: Description:
div.p: determines whether cautionary accidentals should be displayed at a key change.

div.head: Description:
div.p: provides a label for a group of staves on pages after the first page.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the visual rendition of the left barline. It is present here only for facilitation of translation from legacy encodings which use it. Usually, it can be safely ignored.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates this element's participation in a ligature.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: encodes the colors of the staff lines. The value is structured; that is, it should have the same number of space-separated RGB values as the number of lines indicated by the lines attribute. A line can be made invisible by assigning it the same RGB value as the background, usually white.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records whether all stafflines are visible.

div.head: Description:
div.p: holds the staff location of the feature.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the lower-left corner x coordinate.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates whether the base symbol is written vertically or horizontally.

div.head: Description:
div.p: holds the staff location of the mensuration sign.

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes the rotation or reflection of the base symbol.

div.head: Description:
div.p: the base symbol in the mensuration sign/time signature of mensural notation.

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes the relative size of the mensuration sign.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the number lines added to the mensuration sign. For example, one slash is added for what we now call 'alla breve'.

div.head: Description:
div.p: captures the number of beats in a measure, that is, the top number of the meter signature.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains indication of how the meter signature should be rendered.

div.head: Description:
div.p: determines whether a new meter signature should be displayed when the meter signature changes.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the use of a meter symbol instead of a numeric meter signature, that is, 'C' for common time or 'C' with a slash for cut time.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains the number indicating the beat unit, that is, the bottom number of the meter signature.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes melodic function in any convenient typology.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: provides a label for the MIDI instrument.

div.head: Description:
div.p: sets the default MIDI port value.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains a MIDI value, that is, the number of quarter notes per minute in the range from 10 to 1000.

div.head: Description:
div.p: specifies the applicable MIME (multimedia internet mail extension) type. The value should be a valid MIME media type defined by the Internet Engineering Task Force in RFC 2046.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates major, minor, or other tonality.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: sets the default music font size.

div.head: Description:
div.p: provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to store a number to be rendered along with a feature.

div.head: Description:
div.p: captures the amount of horizontal space to be added, expressed in one-half inter-line staff distance units.

div.head: Description:
div.p: identifies the old hand. The value must contain the ID of a hand element given elsewhere in the document.

div.head: Description:
div.p: determines the placement of notes on a 1-line staff. A value of 'yes' places all notes on the line, while a value of 'no' places stems-up notes above the line and stems-down notes below the line.

div.head: Description:
div.p: specifies the distance between the points of the open end of a hairpin dynamic mark.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: Together, proport.num and proport.numbase specify a proportional change as a ratio, e.g., 1:3. Proport.num is for the first value in the ratio.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Together, proport.num and proport.numbase specify a proportional change as a ratio, e.g., 1:3. Proport.numbase is for the second value in the ratio.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains solfa designation, e.g., do, re, mi, etc., in either a fixed or movable Do system.

div.head: Description:
div.p: holds a short phrase describing the reason for missing textual material (gap), why material is supplied (supplied), or why transcription is difficult (unclear).

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains a reference to a previously-declared user-defined symbol.

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to indicate a common, usually centered, refrain (Mup User's Guide, p. 44).

div.head: Description:
div.p: gives the value of a date in standard ISO form.

div.head: Description:
div.p: describes the enclosing shape for rehearsal marks.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the appearance of the barline.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the appearance of the curve.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates whether hash marks should be rendered between systems. See Read, p. 436, ex. 26-3.

div.head: Description:
div.p: captures whether a beam is feathered and in which direction: 'acc' indicates that the secondary beams get progressively closer together, coming together at the end of the beam, while 'rit' means that the secondary beams start at the same point and get progressively more distant.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the appearance of a line.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the number of slashes required to render the appropriate beat repeat symbol when the beat is divided into even notes: 4ths or 8ths=1, 16ths=2, 32nds=3, 64ths=4, 128ths=5. When the beat is comprised of mixed duration values, the symbol is always rendered as 2 slashes and 2 dots. See Read, pg. 223-224.

div.head: Description:
div.p: captures the appearance of the text. One or the other of the rend and altrend attributes is required.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains an indication of how the deletion should be rendered.

div.head: Description:
div.p: when set to 'grid', the chord tablature grid defined in the chordtable should be rendered instead of the text contents of the <harm> element; if rendgrid equals 'gridname', both the <harm> element's text and the grid should be displayed; otherwise, only the 'name' of the chord, i.e., the text content of the <harm> element, e.g. 'Cmaj' or 'V7/III', should be rendered.

div.head: Description:
div.p: captures information regarding responsibility for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding. Its value must point to one or more identifiers declared in the document header.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates that staves begin again with this section.

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to specify a rhythm for the lyrics that differs from that of the notes on the staff.

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates the function of the right barline and is structurally important.

div.head: Description:
div.p: used to specify further information about the entity referenced by this name, for example, the occupation of a person or the status of a place.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A positive value for rotation rotates the text in a counter-clockwise fashion, while negative values produce clockwise rotation.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: identifies the reference point for determining the time of the current when element, which is obtained by adding the interval to the time of the reference point. The value should be the ID of another when element in the same timeline. If the since attribute is omitted, and the absolute attribute is not specified, then then reference point is understood to be the preceding when element.

This value is meaningless for the first staff in a system since the spacing.system attribute indicates the spacing between systems.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: When style is set to 'line', the pedal mark is rendered with a continuous line. When it's set to pedstar, a pedal down and a half pedal are rendered with "Ped.", a pedal up is rendered as "*", and a pedal "bounce" (up then immediately down) is rendered with "* Ped.". When set to altpedstar, pedal up and down indications are the same as with pedstar but a bounce is rendered with "Ped." only.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the fret at which a string should be stopped.

div.head: Description:
div.p: records which string is to be played.

div.head: Description:
div.p: provides a written pitch and octave for each open string, e.g. "e3 a3 d4 g4 b4 e5" for standard guitar tuning. It should contain the number of tokens indicated by the lines attribute. Chromatic alteration may be indicated with '-', or 'f', (flat) and '#', or 's' (sharp). Double sharps and flats are not permitted.

div.head: Description:
div.p: If takt barlines are to be used, then the taktplace attribute may be used to denote the staff location of the shortened barline. The location may include staff lines, spaces, and the spaces directly above and below the staff. The value ranges between 0 (just below the staff) to 2 * number of staff lines (directly above the staff). For example, on a 5-line staff the lines would be numbered 1,3,5,7, and 9 while the spaces would be numbered 0,2,4,6,8,10. For example, a value of '9' puts the barline through the top line of a 5-line staff.

div.head: Description:
div.p: encodes the target note when its pitch differs from the pitch at which the custos appears.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:
div.p: records the amount of diatonic pitch shift, e.g. C to C# = 0, C to Db = 1. Transposition requires both trans.diat and trans.semi attributes in order to distinguish the difference, for example, between a transposition from C to C# and one from C to Db.

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains the amount of pitch shift in semitones, C to C# = 1, C to Db = 1. Transposition requires both trans.diat and trans.semi attributes in order to distinguish the difference, for example, between a transposition from C to C# and one from C to Db.

div.head: Description:
div.p: defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

div.head: Description:
div.p: allows the use of an previously-undeclared URI to identify an external electronic object.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: annot, barline, bibl, ending, extptr, extref, fig, graphic, lem, measure, pb, rdg, section

div.head: Description:
div.p: indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: annot, barline, bibl, ending, extptr, extref, fig, lem, measure, pb, ptr, rdg, ref, section

div.head: Description:
div.p: defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Used by:
div.p: annot, barline, bibl, ending, extptr, extref, fig, lem, measure, pb, ptr, rdg, ref, section

div.head: Description:
div.p: contains a human-readable description of the entire link. A value is optional; if a value is supplied, it should contain a string that describes the resource. The use of this information is highly dependent on the type of processing being done. It may be used, for example, to make titles available to applications used by visually impaired users, or to create a table of links, or to present help text that appears when a user lets a mouse pointer hover over a starting resource.

div.head: Description:
div.p: regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

div.head: Description:
div.p: identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. The values for this attribute are language 'tags' as defined in BCP 47. All language tags that make use of private use subtags must be documented in a corresponding language element in the MEI header whose id attribute is the same as the language tag's value.

div.head: Description:
